intro: Wikstroemia aurantiaca, commonly known as the orange-flowered sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Thymelaeaceae family and is characterized by its showy, orange-yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in coastal and mesic habitats, often found on sandy soils. It has small, lance-shaped leaves and produces fruit that is a capsule containing numerous seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
